name: Hotel Flamingo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is made at my usual nit-picking level and should not detract from the fact that the hotel is well sited, comfortable, generally appointed and run to expectations, serves some very good food and is ideally situated for those wanting to explore between Cagliari and Sant Antioco and as such, combined with its position on the beach, large pool and so on, makes it a good place to stay. However, it misses out on an unreserved recommendation because it falls down in a few areas, some of which I personally consider to be key and most of which would be relatively simple and cheap to correct.
reviews.title: Could easily be better

reviews.text: The hotel comprises a main reception/bar/restaurant block built around the pools with the basic rooms above. The, along the sea side, running east there are a number of blocks of "garden" rooms, some presumably with a sea view and behind them dotted through the gardens four blocks of "Nidi" suites each with ten units on the ground floor and eight above centred around an atrium. First impressions were good (ignoring the obvious need of a lick of paint - it was the end of the season,) and lasted until I sat on the end of the bed: and went through it. It was simple to repair and the missing plastic holders on the ends of the slats suggested this was not personal but had happened on numerous occasions; as it continued to do until I learnt not to sit there. Whilst in the fixing mood, I also sorted out the plug on the bidet.
reviews.title: It could be better

reviews.text: The suites have a bedroom, bathroom with a shower and spa bath (some combined some separate with the bath outside the bathroom (an architectural fancy) a sitting room and an outside terrace or sitting area. Furniture was very tasteful for those of a liking for the "rustic" or "shabby chic." Our facilities were on the ground floor with an inner bathroom (so a combined spa bath and shower - not outside,) bed and sitting rooms and a large terrace with a pair of chairs, a table and a pair of loungers: though no privacy at all: and no shade. It was separated from the much smaller terrace in the next room by a low wall only and, for some reason, their bathroom window let out onto our terrace: so no privacy for either of us! It is worth noting that the extent of the outside space and the furniture it contains varies from room to room. Most had a smaller space than ours and did not seem to have loungers, etc.
reviews.title: Relaxing Holiday

reviews.text: The terrace also had side lighting and a high level lamp ideal for reading at night except that the bulb had blown. Half the bulbs in the suite did not seem to work. After asking for the to be fixed on two separate days, the outside light and that over the dressing table in the bedroom were changed but we were left without any reasonable light at all in the sitting room making it rather pointless after dark: and who would use it during the day? There was a TV in the room but the picture quality was awful and, despite the British being the largest contingent at the hotel (followed by German, Italian and French,) there were only Italian and German channels available. The room also had a mini-bar with a few drinks at ridiculous prices (as they always are) but then nothing more than a horrible plastic cup to drink them from. Why no proper glasses? (It might have been because, like everyone else, we turfed their miserable bottles out of the fridge and stocked up at the mini-market over the road in the adjoining camp site at a fraction of the cost.
reviews.title: Good hotel & holida overall, but only if you can stay in the suites because you get to eat in the brilliant Wild Duck restaurant

reviews.text: We did not use the spa bath. It became obvious that it was necessary to stand on the bath-plug to allow the water to stay in the bath (we did contemplate scrounging a brick or rock from the surrounding countryside to hold it in place but that seemed excessive,) and when the level eventually gained sufficient depth to cover all the inlets and outlets, the unit would not turn on: indeed the control panel was rather loose. Standing in a spa bath would have been pointless anyway. It did start by itself one evening, with no water in the bath (or person in the bathroom,) sounding rather like a road-worker's drill. After a bit it turned itself off. (Impact noises do travel through the concrete building structure by the way.
reviews.title: Relaxing summer holidays by the sea but not in a 4* hotel

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my Holiday and the Flamingo Hotel! Everything about it was amazing!
reviews.title: Best Holiday I've been on!

reviews.text: Our room was a nice size and had a balcony with a good view. The bathroom was also very nice and modern. The room was cleaned perfectly everyday and the cleaners were very friendly, as were most staff in the hotel!
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: Breakfast was outside the main restaurant and it was a buffet with, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and many other things! All of the breakfast food was very tasty!!
reviews.title: One of my favorite holidays, would love to go back!

reviews.text: Lunch was also a buffet with a different selection of food everyday, which was always enjoyable! You could also order ice-cream or salad with your lunch.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good food, but not much to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal was inside the main restaurant and it started at 7:30 You were given a menu to choose your Starter and Main, the menu was different everyday. The waiter's were always very fast! The food was always cooked to a high standard and always tasted very good! Desert was a buffet, which they changed slightly every night but it might be a good idea to get your desert before you have finished your meal because it disappears very quickly!
reviews.title: Had a great time (with a few reservations)

reviews.text: One week at hotel with family and very enjoyable. Good hotel, great food and during the week we were there good to very good entertainment. Would go again.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a regular room for a week (which was easily enough) with a nice view of the river and eucalyptus forest. Decor was very good as was the servicing of the room, however it was often impossible to get a hot shower mainly at the times of heavy use. There was a bidet which helps in that situation! We asked to move and could have after the Italian holiday crush of 15th August was over but by that time could not be bothered. There was no iron and none provided when we asked. The spa was Ok but had shabby spots and did not compare favourably with other 4 star spas. The gym we used every day but it was not swept or cleaned once and there was a curtain dividing the gym from the entertainment team's HQ, they often left the door open causing the inadequate air conditioning to become ineffective and at no time did any staff appear in the gym. The Hotel claims 2 restaurants but there is only 1 in practice and the outside seating is hard to find at breakfast and lunch and not allowed in the evening - at least for us. Queing to be seated and waiting while more food is brought to the buffet at lunch detracts from the good quality of the food in general although why anyone would want to eat salmon while on the Medditerranean I don't know. Drinks are very expensive wine is a minimum of £14.00 per bottle but you can go to the campsite over the road to buy wine etc. If you walk for 20 minutes along the beach (away from Pula) there is another campsite with pizzeria which is even cheaper and has a nice setting. Walking the other way you come to the Nide 5 star bit which looked a bit half built with Wild Duck restaurant (we didn't try it having read the other reviews) then the 3 star Marie Pineda which was peaceful and lovely and far less crowded and noisy. On departure we checked our bill against the slips which we kept and discovered £27.00 had been added for drinks and pizza we didn't have and hadn't signed for. Car hire was around £200 for 3 days minimum, bike hire was £55.00 per day! So we stayed at the hotel but did have a lovely walk along the little gravel road towards Pula. We enjoyed our holiday and the evening entertainment was excellent including a 5 course meal with free sparkling wine and spit roast pork and fireworks on the festival day. Another day there was a seemingly well known Italian singer with a great set. The Hotel Flamingo was like a gentrified Butlins. I will put a film on you tube by 11th Sept illustrating what I mean, just search Hotel Flamingo Laura and Pie.
reviews.title: Relaxing... not 4star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: thoroughly recommend this hotel, the food and ambience were superb,
reviews.title: lovely hotel and grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the pool and beach were lovely very clean and the beach went for miles.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and eat, but beware hidden charges

reviews.text: a bit on the remote side which suited us plus you could get a bus at the end of the road into nearby town and also in to cagliari if you wanted to venture out
reviews.title: Not the 4* hotel they pretend to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a few holidays this year as knew this would be quiet and was what we expected.
reviews.title: Great for a quiet break.

reviews.text: Our room was a bit tired and needed a bit of an upgrade but it was just a few paces from the beach. Wow.
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday with friendly staff. Great for kids

reviews.text: The staff were very good as was the food.
reviews.title: overrated and tired hotel with uninterested staff

reviews.text: Had the Citalia full board upgrade which was a pricesaver as the food off the menu was not cheap.
reviews.title: Stop moaning - excellent value for money

reviews.text: The drinks were not cheap and the option of the campsite was there for a cheap drink but we stayed mostly at the hoter bar as it was not horribly expensive and the service was good.
reviews.title: Great holiday

description: At 35 km distance from port and airport of Sardinia's capital Cagliari, situated in a beautiful landscape, Hotel Flamingo is overlooking it's own beach of soft white sand and the crystal clear turquoise sea. The hotel is situated in an area rich of artistic and cultural sites which can be explored by car. In the year 2004 new opening of 64 rooms, including 20 suites and a Wellness Center.
